content.body: The combined effect of your preferences would be to rename `referrer` to `context`, and if that is what it takes to satisfy Caridy, I’m all for it.

content.body: That is, new Module(source, sharedHandler, context) where sharedHandler = { importHook(specifier, context) => Module }
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: That is, new Module(source, sharedHandler, context) where sharedHandler = { importHook(specifier, context) => Module }

content.body: And from a performance perspective, it doesn’t reduce allocations, but the handler object can be an ephemeral options object, which would presumably go into the nursery and get collected cheaply, instead of being retained for the lifetime of the Module.
